pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.2: a number of nuns were bathing naked at a ford in the river Aciravatī together with sex workers.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.3: The sex workers teased the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.4: “Venerables, why practice the spiritual life when you’re still young? Why not enjoy worldly pleasures?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.5: You can practice the spiritual life when you’re old.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.6: In this way you’ll get the benefit of both.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.8: They then went to the nuns’ dwelling place and told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.10: who in turn told the Buddha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.11: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.12: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the nuns for the following ten reasons:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.13: for the well-being of the Sangha …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.15: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.16.1: ‘If a nun bathes naked, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.1.6: if she bathes without wearing a sarong or an upper robe, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.1.7: At the end of the bath, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.2.2: if her robes have been stolen or lost;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.2.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.2.6: The first training rule is finished.
